text: Maritza Lizeth Gallego Félix is a Mexican journalist, producer and writer on Telemundo Arizona == Career == Maritza was born in Magdalena de Kino, Sonora on October 23, 1982. She graduated with honors from Universidad del Noroeste, in Hermosillo, Sonora, in June 2004. She majored in communications. She has continuing with her education at Tecnológico de Monterrey, the Poynter Institute, and other prestigious institutions in Mexico and USA. == Journalistic trajectory == Maritza Felix began her journalistic career since she enrolled at the university. She completed her internship at Radio Sonora and Televisa Sonora, then became the programming director and on air talent at XEDJ in her hometown Magdalena de Kino. In 2004, she joined Periodicos Healy,PERIODICOS HEALY working for El ImparcialPeriódico El Immparcial and La i. In 2006 she moved to the United States and from Los Angeles, California, she began writing the first chapters of a book that is still in process. In 2009, Félix moved to Phoenix, Arizona, and joined the team of collaborators of Prensa Hispana,PRENSA HISPANA the largest Spanish-language publication in Spanish in Arizona and one of the most renowned publications in the United States. In 2014, she joined the Telemundo Arizona team as a journalist, writer and producer. In 2016, she won her first two Emmy awards, making "Enfoque Arizona" an award-winning political and community show.2016 Emmy Recipients She has been a collaborator for important national and international media such as Javier Solórzano's news program on Radio Fórmula,Grupo Fórmula in Mexico; NTN24 Nuestra TeleNoticias Pagina Oficial de Facebook NTN24Twitter NTN24ve Colombia; Radio Qué Pasa, in North Carolina, QuePasaMedia the public television station in Finland, YLE Puente Project, Telemax, Uniradio, Noticias Tijuana, Baja California, México Grupo Larsa, LARSAVISION TV Organización Editorial Mexicana. Organización Editorial Mexicana In addition, she did an investigative report for a documentary at Discovery Channel Latin America called "Mysteries of the Faith". She is the international representative of the Spanish organization Oceanidas NGO OceanidasTwitter Oceánidas Canal de YoutTube in the United States and North America. In her career, she has had collaborations with Univision (television and radio), Azteca América, TV Azteca, Onda 1190 AM,Bienvenidos a Onda 1190 AM Latino Vibe 95.1FM, 95.1-FM Latino Vibe KVIB among other media. Now she is a journalist, producer and writer on Telemundo Arizona. Telemundo Arizona == Awards and distinctions == She was named as one of the 40 Hispanic leaders under the age of 40 Latino Perspectives Magazine Facebook Valle del Sol AZ in Arizona, by the organizations Valle del Sol Valle del Sol and Chicanos por la Causa. Chicanos por la Causa She has won multiple awards from the Arizona Press Club Arizona Press Club and has swept the state's Spanish-language news contests. In the years of 2012 Phoenix New Times 2012 and 2013, Phoenix New Times 2013 she was named the "Best Spanish-Speaking Journalist in Phoenix" by the Phoenix New Times magazine, one of the most important recognition's among the journalism guild of Arizona; the publication describes her work as "one so good that everyone should learn Spanish to read it". In 2016, just one year after joining Telemundo Arizona, she won her first two Emmys. Telemundo Arizona recibe 25 nominaciones a premios Emmy Univision and Telemundo stations in Chicago and Miami celebrate Emmy wins In 2017 she received three Emmy nominations more. 2017 Emmy Nominees ==References== Category:1982 births Category:Living people Category:Mexican women journalists Category:People from Magdalena de Kino
title: Maritza Lizeth Gallego Félix
